items.value: Aims to reduce the impact of errors on the outcomes of computation by doing classical post-processing, without explicitly correcting the error.
Instead of correcting errors, it involves estimation and compensating for the errors in the final results.
Representing errors and imperfections. Error rates, decoherence mechanism, spatial and temporal correlations, damping (amplitude and Phase), random unitary, depolarisation.
Richardson extrapolation, measurement error mitigation, and error amplification are methods used to adjust quantum results based on error models.

Intermediate level of computational capability and their susceptibility to noise. NISQ devices are not fully fault-tolerant, meaning they can produce erroneous results. Not yet error-corrected but are used with error mitigation.
Use quantum where parallelism is implementable.
Depends on effectiveness of the noise models and assumptions made about the errors.
Require additional resources, reducing the advantage.
